meanings.definition: A small silver coin in ancient Greece.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Greece, people used an obolus to buy goods.
meanings.sent2: The obolus was a common form of currency in ancient times.
meanings.sent3: The obolus rolled away like a tiny silver wheel.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter tinkled like an obolus in the air.
meanings.sent5: The obolus gleamed in the sunlight, a tiny piece of history.

meanings.sent1: She made an obolus to the charity every month.
meanings.sent2: The obolus from the community helped rebuild the school.
meanings.sent3: The obolus danced into the donation box with a little hop.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was an obolus in the sea of indifference.
meanings.sent5: The obolus of support warmed her heart on a cold day.
